profileText: A Representative from Vermont; born in Barre, Mass., August 12, 1789; attended the common schools; moved to St. Albans, Vt.; studied law; was admitted to the bar in 1810 and commenced practice in St. Albans, Vt.; State's attorney for Franklin County 1826-1832; member of the State house of representatives 1827-1837, and served as speaker from 1831 to 1833; elected as a Democrat to the Twenty-sixth Congress (March 4, 1839-March 3, 1841); unsuccessful candidate for reelection in 1840 to the Twenty-seventh Congress; engaged in the construction of railroads; died in St. Albans, Vt., November 26, 1858; interment in Greenwood Cemetery.

researchRecord.name: 1828-1854. 6 inches.
researchRecord.description: Business and congressional papers and correspondence, chiefly concerning railroads. Finding aid in repository.

researchRecord.name: In the J. Gregory Smith papers, 1810-1899, 8 linear feet.
1810-1827. In Smith family papers, 1797-1956.
researchRecord.description: 15 feet. Relate to his law practice. Unpublished finding aid in repository.

researchRecord.name: In the John Smith family Vermont & Canada Railroad papers, 1838-1923, 1.25 linear feet.
